clustering_scheme.rationale: The system is best understood as three tightly-coupled modules: a contributor pipeline (people stocks/flows), a knowledge spiral (SECI processes and artifacts), and a mentoring/capacity module (CoP participation support). This arrangement localizes dense internal linkages while keeping only a few clear bridging links among clusters.

clusters.name: Contributor Development Pipeline
clusters.theme: Movement of people through newcomer → experienced → core, including entry, progression, and exits.

clusters.name: Knowledge Spiral & Artifacts (SECI)
clusters.theme: Creation, decay, and use of tacit and explicit knowledge via socialization, externalization, combination, and internalization.

clusters.name: Mentoring & Community Capacity (CoP)
clusters.theme: Mentoring supply vs. demand and its coverage, shaping social learning, onboarding outcomes, and advancement.

layout_hints: Place Contributor Development Pipeline at the center; it has the most inter-cluster links.
Position Knowledge Spiral & Artifacts to the left of the Pipeline and Mentoring & Community Capacity to the right.
Route Mentoring Coverage links above the Pipeline to reduce crossings with SECI links that run below.
Keep knowledge stocks (explicit/tacit) visually aligned to simplify inflow/outflow depiction.

theories.name: Communities of Practice (Wenger)
theories.rationale: The current model captures participation trajectories (new → experienced → core) and mentorship, but lacks capacity constraints and dropout dynamics central to legitimate peripheral participation. Adding mentoring supply/demand and onboarding/exit flows operationalizes how participation is socially supported or fails, creating reinforcing/balancing loops that shape community growth and role progression. These changes increase behavioral realism and make mentoring an explicit design lever.

variables.name: Contributor Prospect Pool
variables.description: Potential contributors aware of or interested in the project and available to onboard.

variables.name: Newcomer Onboarding Rate
variables.description: Rate at which prospects become active new contributors.

variables.name: Newcomer Dropout Rate
variables.description: Rate at which new contributors disengage before becoming experienced.

variables.name: Experienced Contributor Turnover
variables.description: Rate at which experienced contributors exit the community.

variables.name: Core Developer Mentoring Capacity
variables.description: Effective mentoring hours or slots provided by core developers per unit time.

variables.name: Mentoring Demand
variables.description: Aggregate mentoring need from new contributors (e.g., estimated hours/requests).

variables.name: Mentoring Coverage
variables.description: Ratio of available mentoring capacity to mentoring demand (0..1+, where >1 indicates surplus).

variables.name: colored stock
variables.rationale: Specificity and alignment with onboarding dynamics.

variables.name: Developer's Turnover
variables.rationale: Clarifies which role the turnover flow applies to.

variables.name: Skill up
variables.rationale: Clarifies as a flow from New Contributors to Experienced Contributors.

variables.name: Promotion Rate
variables.rationale: Clarifies flow from Experienced Contributors to Core Developer.

theories.name: Nonaka's SECI Model
theories.rationale: The model distinguishes implicit/explicit transfer but lacks knowledge stocks and the SECI subprocesses. Adding tacit and explicit knowledge stocks with creation, update, and decay flows enables socialization (mentoring), externalization (capture), combination (updates), and internalization (learning) to interact. This structure captures knowledge accumulation/erosion and its impact on onboarding and advancement.

variables.name: Community Tacit Knowledge
variables.description: Effective tacit know-how embedded in people and shared practices across the community.

variables.name: Tacit Knowledge Accumulation Rate
variables.description: Rate at which tacit knowledge grows via socialization and learning-by-doing.

variables.name: Tacit Knowledge Erosion Rate
variables.description: Loss of tacit knowledge due to turnover and technological change.

variables.name: Project Explicit Knowledge
variables.description: Effective explicit knowledge base (documentation, guides) adjusted for quality and relevance.

variables.name: Documentation Creation & Update Rate
variables.description: Rate of authoring and refactoring docs (externalization/combination).

variables.name: Documentation Obsolescence Rate
variables.description: Rate at which explicit knowledge becomes outdated or inaccurate.

variables.name: Externalization Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of converting tacit knowledge into high-quality, reusable documentation.

variables.name: Internalization Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness with which contributors learn from explicit knowledge.

variables.name: Technology Change Rate
variables.description: Pace of technology or requirements change that drives knowledge obsolescence.
